@tschmidt64-SC Pulsar client library uses SLF4J for logging. The logging configuration will depend on your logger implementation (eg. Log4J, Logback, etc...).

rerun java8 tests
rerun integration tests

run Integration Tests
run java8 tests

> Can you update the description with stack trace or the error scenario you faced due to the null?

`EntryCacheDisabled` mainly used by tests and broker with low memory and at that time readcall back expects given ctx which comes as null and doesn't complete the dispatch.

@sijie Sorry, just saw this message because I was overwhelmed by review emails.
LGTM.
@tuteng would you please also help review it?

@jiazhai @merlimat @cckellogg 

I removed the batch-related logic from the current pull request and modified the logic in a [new pull request](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/4475). 

PTAL thanks.

Before you merge the current pull request, please merge [pull/4475](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/4475)

run java8 tests
run integration tests

**To Reproduce**

Execute following command:

```
$ seq 1 100 | xargs -I ZZ -P 100 curl -LI dev-broker.pulsar.co.jp:4080/admin/persistent/tenant/global/ns/partitioned-topic10/partitioned-stats -o /dev/null -w '%{http_code}\n' -s
```

It seems that all `pulsar-web` threads are trying to execute `getPartitionedStats`, however there are no more "free" threads which can respond topic stats for partitions (`<topicname>-partition-0`,  `<topicname>-partition-1`, `<topicname>-partition-2`, ...)
Ok, now I found it, let me explore this a little bit further
@nkurihar do you see any exception in the log specially related to async-zk-cache?
@nkurihar i think #4484 will help to avoid deadlock in broker.

rerun java8 tests 
rerun integration tests
While #4484 is fine, I think we should rather use the async REST  handler for this operation

> I think we should rather use the async REST handler for this operation

I don't think that will help much because broker is not using async servlet and web-thread has to wait till it receives all the async responses for all partitions. so, in that case also, broker has to add timeout on the blocking call to avoid deadlock.
We can use async handler for the partitioned topics stats. That will not block the Jetty thread in the first place

@rdhabalia @merlimat 
Thank you for your help!

> do you see any exception in the log specially related to async-zk-cache?

No, I don't see exceptions related to async-zk-cache.

> We can use async handler for the partitioned topics stats

yes..let me make the change.

@rshermanTHG  some files need ASF2 license in header:
Here is an error reported:
```
[WARNING] Missing header in: /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/pulsar_precommit_java8/dashboard/django/stats/static/stats/additional.css
```

rerun cpp tests
rerun java8 tests
@Jennifer88huang or @Anonymitaet can any of you help reviewing this documentation change?

I've got the same error , but running locally has not been replicated

https://builds.apache.org/job/pulsar_precommit_java8/9586/testReport/junit/org.apache.pulsar.broker.service/ReplicatorRateLimiterTest/testReplicatorRateLimiterMessageReceivedAllMessages/

`
org.apache.pulsar.client.admin.PulsarAdminException$ConflictException: Namespace already exists
	at org.apache.pulsar.client.admin.internal.BaseResource.getApiException(BaseResource.java:216)
	at org.apache.pulsar.client.admin.internal.NamespacesImpl.createNamespace(NamespacesImpl.java:176)
	at org.apache.pulsar.broker.service.PeerReplicatorTest.testPeerClusterInReplicationClusterListChange(PeerReplicatorTest.java:198)
`

hello @jerrypeng , `logTopic` and `./bin/pulsar-admin functions`  command line parameters provided can help users to locate function-related problems. Do we consider adding them?

```
$ ./bin/pulsar-admin functions trigger
$ ./bin/pulsar-admin functions putstate
$ ./bin/pulsar-admin functions querystate
$ ./bin/pulsar-admin functions stats
$ ./bin/pulsar-admin functions status(getstatus)
...
```
@merlimat could you attach a link to the PR description to make it easier to find the other changes for the series?

I have now made the following changes to the pulsar-common module:
- Classes in package org.apache.pulsar.common.api are moved to org.apache.pulsar.common.protocol
- Classes in package org.apache.pulsar.common.schema are moved to org.apache.pulsar.common.protocol.schema

All other changes are reference updates in places that depend on any of these classes performed automatically by IntelliJ.

This is just a suggestion, please provide feedback of what name to use for the the packages, or on whether moving all these classes is a viable option.
@wolfstudy yup there are many ways to instrument a function.  We can keep adding to this document

@KIC this is caused by transient dependencies depending on slightly different versions of grpc-core.  Please explicitly set he versions of those dependencies in your pom.  Please refer to:

https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/master/pom.xml

@merlimat @rdhabalia @jiazhai this change is mostly isolated from existing code. but since it adds a few fields in the acknowledge path for transaction support. the code path will not be activated until transaction is enabled. I would like you guys also to have a look at this path as well.
